intro: Buchenavia amazonia, commonly known as the Amazonian buchenavia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its habitat in tropical rainforests, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has potential medicinal uses.
